solution_line_template: Her gas is half the price as her ${groceries_cost} groceries so that's {groceries_cost}/{gas_divisor} = $<<{groceries_cost}/{gas_divisor}={gas_cost}>>{gas_cost} in gas

Her card has a balance of ${initial_balance} and she added ${groceries_cost} in groceries and ${gas_cost} in gas for a total of {initial_balance}+{groceries_cost}+{gas_cost} = $<<{initial_balance}+{groceries_cost}+{gas_cost}={balance_after_additions}>>{balance_after_additions}

Her balance is ${balance_after_additions} and she returns ${returned_amount} worth of merchandise for a new balance of {balance_after_additions}-{returned_amount} = $<<{balance_after_additions}-{returned_amount}={final_balance}>>{final_balance}
